data.title: University of Chicago Law School
data.text:
Publications

Books (Author)

Law and Economics: Theory, Cases, and Other Materials - Aspen Casebook Series (1 ed.) (Aspen, 2021) (with J. Shahar Dillbary).

The Behavior of Federal Judges: a Theoretical and Empirical Study of Rational Choice (Harvard University Press, 2013) (with Richard A. Posner & Lee Epstein ).cu

The Political Economy of Intellectual Property Law (AEI-Brookings Joint Center for Regulatory Studies, 2004) (with Richard A. Posner).cu

The Economic Structure of Intellectual Property Law (Harvard University Press, 2003) (with Richard A. Posner) (also published in Spanish and Chinese).cu

Winning the Art Lottery: The Economic Returns to the Ganz Collection (University of Chicago Law School, 2000).cu

The Economic Structure of Tort Law (Harvard University Press, 1987) (with Richard A. Posner) (also published in Chinese).cu

Essays in the Economics of Crime and Punishment (National Bureau of Economic Research, 1974) (with Gary S. Becker).cu

Journal Articles

"When It Comes to Business, the Right and Left Sides of the Court Agree," 54 Washington University Journal of Law and Policy 33 (2017) (with Lee Epstein & Richard A. Posner). cu

"The Best for Last: The Timing of U.S. Supreme Court Decisions," 64 Duke Law Journal 101 (2015) (with Lee Epstein & Richard A. Posner). cu www

"Revisiting the Ideology Rankings of Supreme Court Justices," 44 Journal of Legal Studies S295 (2015) (with Lee Epstein & Richard A. Posner). cu www

"How Business Fares in the Supreme Court," 97 Minnesota Law Review 1431 (2013) (with Richard A. Posner & Lee Epstein ). cu

"Was There Ever Such a Thing as Judicial Self-Restraint?," 100 California Law Review 557 (2012) (with Lee Epstein). cu

"Are Even Unanimous Decisions in the United States Supreme Court Ideological?," 106 Northwestern University Law Review 699 (2012) (with Richard A. Posner & Lee Epstein). cu

"Measuring Coase's Influence," 54 Journal of Law and Economics S383 (2011) (with Sonia Lahr-Pastor). cu

"Why (and When) Judges Dissent: A Theoretical and Empirical Analysis," 3 Journal of Legal Analysis 101 (2011) (with Richard A. Posner & Lee Epstein). cu

"An Empirical Analysis of Intellectual Property Litigation: Some Preliminary Results," 41 Houston Law Review 749 (2004). cu

"The Empirical Side of Law and Economics," 70 University of Chicago Law Review 167 (2003). cu

"Adjudication as a Private Good," 8 Journal of Legal Studies 235 (1979) (with Richard A. Posner). cu

"The Bail System: An Economic Approach," 2 Journal of Legal Studies 79 (1973). cu

"Compulsory Schooling Legislation: An Economic Analysis of Law and Social Change in the Nineteenth Century," 32 Journal of Economic History 54 (1972) (with Lewis Solomon). cu

"An Economic Analysis of the Courts," 14 Journal of Law and Economics 61 (1971). cu

"The Economics of Fair Employment Laws," 76 Journal of Political Economy 507 (1968). cu

"The Effect of State Fair Employment Laws on the Economic Position of Nonwhites," 57 American Economic Review 578 (1967). cu

"Copyright," in Handbook of Cultural Economics, Ruth Towse & Trilce N. Hern√°ndez eds. (Northamptom: Edward Elgar Publishing, 2020).

"The Art of Law and Economics: An Autobiographical Essay," in Law and Economics: A Reader, Alain Marciano ed. (Routledge, 2009). cu

"The Test of Time: Does Twentieth Century American Art Survive?," in Contributions to Economic Analysis: The Economics of Art and Culture, Victor A. Ginsburgh ed. (Elsevier Science, 2004). cu

"Acts of Terror with Guns: Multiple Victim Shootings.," in The Bias against Guns (2003) (with John Lott). cu

"Copyright, Borrowed Images, and Appropriation Art: An Economic Approach," in Copyright in the Cultural Industries, Ruth Towse ed. (Edward Elgar, 2002). cu

"The Social Market for the Great Masters and Other Collectibles," in Social Economics: Market Behavior in a Social Environment (Harvard University Press, 2000) (with Gary S. Becker & Kevin Murphy). cu

"The Art of Law and Economics: An Autobiographical Essay," in Passion and Craft: Economists at Work, Michael Szenberg ed. (University of Michigan Press, 1999). cu

"Gary S. Becker," in The New Palgrave Dictionary of Economics and the Law 1., Peter Newman ed. 1998). cu

"The Economics of Legal Disputes over the Ownership of Works of Art and Other Collectibles," in Essays in the Economics of the Arts, Victor A. Ginsburgh & Pierre-Michel Menger eds. (Elsevier Science, 1996) (with Richard A. Posner). cu

"An Introduction to the Economics of Antitrust," in Antitrust: Cases, Economic Notes, and Other Materials, Richard A. Posner & Frank H. Easterbrook eds. (West, 1980). cu

"The Bail System: An Economic Approach," in Essays in the Economics of Crime and Punishment, Gary S. Becker & William M. Landes eds. (National Bureau of Economic Research, 1974). cu

"An Economic Analysis of the Courts," in Essays in the Economics of Crime and Punishment, Gary S. Becker & William M. Landes eds. (National Bureau of Economic Research, 1974). cu
